The Mathematical Language Processing Group at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign does langauge processing research on unique data modalities with a focus on mathematical/technical content. We focus on solving real-world language processing tasks such as information retrieval and text comprehension/generation using a variety of computing techniques (machine learning, novel algorithmic methods, formal verification methods, etc.).

News

  • December 07, 2022
    It’s official. Mr. Neeraj Gangwar won the NL4Opt-Task2 challenge. He beat out many better-resourced academic-institutions and private-companies and we could not be more proud of him! Check out his poster and presentation.
  • September 22, 2022
    Ms. Emma Hamel is presented her work on mathematical token definition extraction at CICM’22. Her first paper and she’s not even a graduate student yet! And if that isn’t enough, check out the git repo where she shares the dataset and code for several machine learning models.
